loginPage.greetings: If you do not have an account and you want to learn more about working with us, write to the mail - email@gmail.com
loginPage.label: Login
loginPage.loginError: You entered the wrong username or password

homePage.aboutPlatformText: An interactive online programming school where students gain knowledge by creating mini-projects and applications, as well as reinforce practical skills with the help of tests and automatic code validation.
homePage.learningText: Everything for programming training. These are video lessons, presentations, books, practical exercises, tests and exams
homePage.projectsText: Knowledge is given in the context of projects and practical applications.
homePage.codeText: Students program practical exercises on the platform itself. Automating the process makes learning interactive and exciting
homePage.webinarsText: On the platform, children directly ask questions to teachers. We also hold webinars and social media conferences on the FAQ.
homePage.childrenLabel: Is online education suitable for children?
homePage.childrenText: We need a computer, internet and sometimes a phone. You don’t need to bring a child to the courses or go by yourself. When we conducted full-time classes, someone was late or missed a class. Then he couldn’t join because he missed the material
homePage.childrenDifferenText: Someone grasps quickly, someone slowly. Some people like to create games and other applications. In face-to-face training, it is difficult to provide an individual approach. We have children doing what is interesting and at a comfortable speed in the courses. At the end each student creates his own unique project.
homePage.createText: We are actively promoting the idea of ​​creating something yourself. Our homework is always practical projects that students can boast of on an instagram, put them on the application market or in case of emergency, set parents on the phone and force them to use.
homePage.introvertText: Programming requires a complete immersion in the problem to solve the problem. Online training eliminates the possibility of distracting from classes, leaving the teacher and student alone. Students can watch a video, ask a clarifying question to the teacher, or simply experiment without fear of peer ridicule. Students can revise There is a video, ask a clarifying question to the teacher, or just experiment, without fear of peer ridicule.
